topic.title: zeronet sure does take up alota space doesnt it?
topic.body: i've been on here for a relatively small amount of time on zeronet stored on a 1 gb usb drive (encrypted with veracrypt) but space seems to quickly fill up on my usb.  how do all of you deal with this issue?

1565342542_16vtDQkRKY8atc9K3oCBTvMW1ojLL.body:
> [anonkraut](#comment_14_1JpWZr3hPmL8cYSKQCzuqUyhG25UuQsjPh): 1GB? It's 2019 mate. We are talking TB now.

Haha, yeah I just pulled up some old USB card that I've never used.

> [xcape2net](#comment_227_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): When I first came to ZeroNet in early June, ZeroTalk had about 6 MB of data.  That's for all conversations from early 2015 through June 2019.  In the last 24 hours, ZeroTalk has added about 10 MB.  At that rate, ZeroTalk will be about 3.6 GB in a year.  That's a lot of data.  That can't continue to increase year after year.

I see, so this is a very recent development then, huh.
